page.title: 19PIG FARMING AT LARCHWOOD
page.content: 350 sows, with their progeny,being fed to approx:18 weeks,are being kept to 70kg liveweight at Larchwood Farm,Longville.The pigs are sold on contract to Walsall & Birmingham, where they are used to supply the fresh meat trade. The pigs are fed on "brought-in" compounds, and the"muck", mainly in the form of"slurry",is taken by local farmers as a valuable fertiliser for their grassland and arable crops. Pig production,as with poultry,is the only Agricultural Commodity not supported by any major E.E.C.(European Economic Community)protective measures;the price they make, being purely a reflection of the market price.Whilst the main input into the pig,grain,has to be purchased at inflated prices;again, because of E.E.C. protective measures.
